intro: Phacelia sanzinii, commonly known as the San Bernardino phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its small, blue to purple flowers and hairy foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, often found in mountainous regions. It has small, narrow leaves and produces numerous flowers that bloom in the spring. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
